intro: Rhacoma longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved rhacoma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. Rhacoma longifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
